intro: Erythrospermum laurei, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that produces striking red, bell-shaped flowers during the winter months. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The plant is well adapted to dry conditions and is often used in ornamental gardening.
